Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] adding seeds through bean browser doesn't work
 in heritrix 3.3 snapshot
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=FmKDvCFwZckomw73zeql73hvyYSsDrR3JTulAWMg94K9
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo
From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>

On 6/18/14, 6:00 AM, src_psu@... [archive-crawler] wrote:
> I have been trying to add a new seed through heritrix bean browser. I
> modified the seeds.textsource.value to add another seed, but heritrix
> didn't crawl it. However, I added another seed in action/.seeds file,
> that did work. Anyone faced the same problem?
>
> I am using heritrix 3.3 built from source code from original git repo.
> Has anybody faced the same problem?

Seeds are read from the configuration at crawl launch time. Adding a new 
seed via the Bean Browser only affects the data for a single 'built' 
job, and even then, by the time you can change it in the Bean Browser 
that data has already been consulted.

When added to a referenced .seeds file (or inline list in the CXML), the 
next launch will see it. In a mid-crawl dropped 'action' file, it'll be 
swept into the crawl by the action-process.

You could mimic the code-path that's use by the ActionDirectory inside 
the Scripting Console... but no state-edits in the Bean Browser will add 
a seed.

- Gordon
